Also, for these structures, strong surface charge recombination of the excess carriers near the crystal
surfaces created by short-wavelength light was observed.

) is one of most popular lead-free
perovskite materials due to its air stability. Since the chemical composition of such a material is
similar to organic–inorganic lead halide perovskites, the synthetic routes of ﬁlmformation developed
for lead-based perovskites, such as two-step deposition method, can be adopted for the Bi-based
perovskites resulting in controllable morphology and high surface quality. Thus, in the work [
